If there is a downside to this near-miraculous fission, it's that the device is limited by the quantity of power available, which is used to maintain the temperature output. In other words, the machine works best with hot gas.

The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo-designed} 'Slot Mate' vending machine allows storage of almost any item, while also operating as a distribution point for working with {LINK:TradingPage;Traders}. You cannot trade without a vending machine, or its more advanced equivalent, the {THING:StructureRefrigeratedVendingMachine}. Each vending machine can hold up to 100 stacks.
The Hardsuit Helmet is similar to the {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet}, but can withstand higher temperatures and pressures. It's perfect for enduring harsh environments like Venus and Vulcan.

The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Re:Gurge is a handy unit for unloading any items inserted into it, and feeding them into a chute network. For instance, if you add a full {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, the Re:Gurge will empty a mining belt of its contents, insert them into the chute network, then insert the mining belt itself. A {THING:StructureSorter} is recommended to reclaim the mining belt.
Output = 0 exporting the main item Output = 1 exporting items inside and eventually the main item.
Effectively deprecated. Use {THING:ItemFern} directly.
This kit produces a {THING:DynamicLiquidCanisterEmpty}.
A tasty food item. Unlike normal plants, it consumes {GAS:Oxygen} and outputs {GAS:CarbonDioxide}. Mushrooms will only mature at a moderate rate in darkness, and prolonged light will kill it.
Pumpkins are a perennial plant, with both a long growth time, and a long time between harvests. Its low requirement for darkness allows for accelerated growing if provided with extra light.
Rice grows at a moderate rate as long as its supplied with plenty of water. Being more dependant on water, rice plants can easily die during periods of drought.
This backpack can be useful when you are working inside and don't need to fly around.

The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} jetpack isn't 'technically' a jetpack at all, it's a gas thruster. It can be powered by any gas, so long as the internal pressure of the {LINK:AtmosphericsPage;canister} is higher than the ambient external pressure. If the external pressure is greater, the spacepack will not function. Adjusting the thrust value alters your rate of acceleration, while activating the stablizer causes the spacepack to hover when a given height is reached. The hardsuit jetpack is capable of much higher speeds than the {THING:ItemJetpackBasic} - up to 15m/s. Indispensable for building, mining and general movement, it has fourteen storage slots. USE: 'J' to activate; 'space' to fly up; 'left ctrl' to descend; and 'WASD' to move.
Klaxons allow you to play over 50 announcements and sounds, depending on your {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} set-up. Set the mode to select the output.

When inserted into a {THING:ItemTablet} and used in conjunction with a {THING:DynamicGPR}, the scanner will display minerals hidden underground in different colors on the tablet.
Iron and Nickle = red Ice, Lead, Cobalt = cyan Gold and Silver = green Coal and Silicon = magenta Copper and Oxite = yellow Volatiles and Uranium = white

When placed in a {THING:StructureComputer}, the IC Editor allows players to write and edit IC code, which can then be uploaded to a {THING:ItemIntegratedCircuit10} if housed in an {THING:StructureCircuitHousing}.

Landing pad capable of handling a small trade shuttle. When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms}, a {THING:StructureSatelliteDish}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine} enables the ability to trade with suppliers. You need a communications signal of 95% or above to establish reliable communications with a trader.

This medium communications unit can be used to communicate with nearby trade vessels.
When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms} motherboard, a {THING:Landingpad_CenterPiece01}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine}, this allows Stationeers to contact traders. Adjust its horizontal and vertical attributes either directly or through logic.

When placed in a {THING:StructureComputer} and connected to a {THING:Landingpad_DataConnectionPiece}, a {THING:StructureSatelliteDish}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine} allows Stationeers to trade with suppliers. Adjust the horizontal and vertical attributes of the {THING:StructureSatelliteDish} either directly or through logic. You need a communications signal of 95% or above to establish reliable communications with a trader. A minimum of a 3x3 clear pad area with a {THING:Landingpad_CenterPiece01} at the center is required for a trader to land.

Sometimes mining trips require something a little bigger to bring home the goods. This scaled up version of the {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} 'Topo' design {THING:ItemMiningDrill} can literally move mountains. The heavy mining drill will remove more ground and mine {LINK:OrePage;ore} more quickly than the standard mining drill. The heavy mining drill is also resilient to temperature and pressure. So no matter what planet or extreme weather conditions may be present, the Recurso heavy mining drill will get the job done.
Not spawnable.
Used for generating power from sunlight. Efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair it using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

Designed by - presumably drunk - {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} roboticists, AIMeE (or Automated Independent Mechanical Entity) can be a {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer's} best friend, or tiresome nemesis, or both several times in the same day.
Intended to unearth and retrieve ores automatically, the unit requires basic programming knowledge to operate, and {THING:MotherboardProgrammableChip}.
AIMEe has 7 modes:
RobotMode.None = 0 = Do nothing RobotMode.None = 1 = Follow nearest player RobotMode.None = 2 = Move to target in straight line RobotMode.None = 3 = Wander around looking for ores in 15 co-ords radius RobotMode.None = 4 = Unload in chute input or chute bin within 3 meters / 1.5 large grids RobotMode.None = 5 = Path(find) to target RobotMode.None = 6 = Automatic assigned state, shows when storage slots are full
The advanced furnace comes with integrated inlet and outlet pumps for controlling the unit's internal pressure.

Due to the original Stationeer manual collapsing into a singularity, Astroloy recipes have been warped by spacetime contortions. The correct Astroloy recipe, as memorialized for all time in a series of charming plastic icons, is 1.0 Copper, 1.0 Cobalt, and 2.0 Steel.

Cobalt is a chemical element with the symbol "Co" and is typically found in only small deposits. Cobalt is a rare substance, but used create the {THING:ItemHealPill} and several {LINK:IngotPage;alloys}.

RecordThing.Value: Composite Cladding (Angled Corner Inner Long R)
Composite Cladding (Angled Corner Inner Long L)

RecordThing.Description: Apply to an {THING:StructureElectronicsPrinter} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.
Apply to an {THING:StructureAutolathe} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.
Apply to an {THING:StructureHydraulicPipeBender} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.
Apply to an {THING:StructureToolManufactory} with a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} or {THING:ItemArcWelder} to upgrade for increased processing speed and more recipe options.

Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a sub-network of cables, to prevent overloading {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} systems. Medium transformers are used in larger setups where more than 5000W is required, with output that can be set to a maximum of 25000W. Note that transformers also operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

Transformers control the maximum power that will flow down a sub-network of cables, to prevent overloading {LINK:ElectronicPage;electrical} systems. Medium transformers are used in larger setups where more than 5000W is required, with output that can be set to a maximum of 25000W. Note that transformers also operate as data isolators, preventing data flowing into any network beyond it.

The basic {LINK:CHAC;CHAC} jetpack isn't 'technically' a jetpack, it's a gas thruster. It can be powered by any gas, so long as the internal pressure of the {LINK:AtmosphericsPage;canister} is higher than the ambient external pressure. If the external pressure is greater, the spacepack will not function. Indispensable for building, mining and general movement, it has ten storage slots and lets {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} fly at 3m/s, compared to the more powerful {THING:ItemHardJetpack}. Adjusting the thrust value alters your rate of acceleration, while activating the stabilizer causes the spacepack to hover when a given height is reached. USE: 'J' to activate; 'space' to fly up; 'left ctrl' to descend; and 'WASD' to move.

RecordThing.Value: Picture Frame Thick Mount Portrait Small
Picture Frame Thick Mount Portrait Large

RecordThing.Description: The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} SquareDig autominer is a structure that when built will mine a vertical 2x2 shaft until it hits bedrock. The autominer can be connected to a chute system, and is controllable by a logic network. Note that the autominer outputs more {LINK:OrePage;ore} than a conventional {THING:ItemMiningDrill} over the same area.

A container the will fill with Dirt when using a {THING:ItemMiningDrill} when placed inside a {THING:ItemMiningBelt}. You can then use this {SLOT:DirtCanister} with the {THING:ItemTerrainManipulator} to adjust the terrain to suit your needs.

The cargo module has capacity for two ten-slot crates. You can have multiple cargo modules on your rocket. The rocket can lift up to seven modules in total. This cargo will be released in orbit and descend the surface of your destination. Unless that happens to be the asteroid belt, in which case it will be left floating serenely in the void.

The command module must be placed on top of the rocket, and will assess the rocket’s readiness for flight. Once all conditions are met, the rocket can be launched when all players are seated in the module by pressing ‘IGNITION’ on the console.
The following conditions must be met for launch:
- Fuel full - Fuel mix ratio correct - a 2:1 mixture of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}. - All players seated - Power supplied to the {THING:StructureLaunchPad} - Fully built rocket
The {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01} console displays the current state of these conditions. It does not require an atmosphere for lift off - your suit’s atmosphere is sufficient. When landing, the rocket will deploy a lander, and any cargo contained in the {THING:StructureModularRocketCargo01} module.

Adapted slightly from its original {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} design, the {GAS:Volatiles} Combustor does exactly what its name suggests - it burns a mixture of volatiles and {GAS:Oxygen} to create water. Extremely useful in hot or arid environments, users need to be aware that the combustor outputs considerable waste heat. The device is also less than perfectly efficient, resulting in the autoignition of volatiles in the chamber, and the production of waste gases which must be dealt with.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
Insulated pipes greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.

The advanced {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Padi 2 tablet is an improved version of the basic {THING:ItemTablet}, boasting two {LINK:CartridgePage;cartridge} slots. The Padi 2 accepts {THING:CartridgeAtmosAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeTracker}, {THING:CartridgeMedicalAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeOreScanner}, {THING:CartridgeElectronicReader}, and various other cartridges.
This kit produces varieties of {THING:StructureInsulatedPipeStraight}, which greatly reduce heat loss from gases stored in them.
The modular rocket engine is capable of lifting up to seven modules, including itself. It must be fueled by at least one {THING:StructureModularRocketFueltank01}.

The rocket fueltank requires a 2:1 mixture of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}. If the mixture exceeds these proportions, or you place other {LINK:GasPage;gases} in the tank, the {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01} console will display an ‘Invalid’ error.
Note that the rocket fueltank can also be used to collect gas mined by the {THING:StructureModularRocketGasMining}, when connected to that unit by a {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketCargo01}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureLaunchPad}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketEngine01}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketFueltank01}.

The pipe organ can be attached to one end of a {THING:ItemPipeValve}. The length of the pipe after the pipe organ changes the pitch of the note it will play when the valve is opened. Use {LINK:LogicPage;Logic} to open and close the valves to create some custom tunes for your base or an audible warning.
Creates a {THING:StructurePipeOrgan}.
The Sensor Processing unit can be inserted into {THING:ItemSensorLenses} to reveal underground minerals in a HUD.

These {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} glasses might not be the most fashionable thing, but when a {THING:ItemSensorProcessingUnitOreScanner} is inserted, Stationeers can use these handy glasses to x-ray the ground and find ores that are hidden beneath the surface.

{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} basic solar panels generate power from sunlight. They lie flat to the ground, and their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.

{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} basic solar panels generate power from sunlight, sitting at 45 degrees to the ground. Their efficiency is reduced during storms and when damaged. You can repair these using some trusty {THING:ItemDuctTape}.
This kit creates a standing solar panel.

The majestic silo holds large quantities of almost anything. While it is doing that, it cannot be deconstructed. Note also, that any food you put into a silo is likely to {LINK:DecayPage;decay} extremely rapidly. The silo can hold up to 600 stacks.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureSDBSilo}.

Modular door pieces for creating large hangar doors.
1 x 1 modular door piece for building hangar doors.
1 x 2 modular door piece for building hangar doors.
1 x 3 modular door piece for building hangar doors.

Providing even better large-scale, reliable power storage than the {THING;StructureBattery}, the {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} 'Da Dianchi' large station battery is the heart of most {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} bases. There are a variety of cautions to the design of electrical systems using batteries, and every experienced Stationeer has a story to tell, hence the Stationeer adage: 'Dianzi cooks, but it also frys.' {HEADER:POWER OUTPUT} Able to store up to 9000001 watts of power, there are no practical limits to its throughput, hence it is wise to use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}. Seasoned electrical engineers will also laugh in the face of those who fail to separate out their power generation networks using an {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl} and {THING:StructureTransformer}.

Use above a {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray} or {THING:StructureHydroponicsTrayData} to manage the planting and harvest of your crops. It contains a button that will allow you to activate it's modes, or connect it to a logic system to do this for you. The modes indicate current growth status of the plant below. Import is used for planting, and harvested plants are sent to export.

Use above a {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray} or {THING:StructureHydroponicsTrayData} to manage the planting and harvest of your crops. It contains a button that will allow you to activate it's modes, or connect it to a logic system to do this for you. The modes indicate current growth status of the plant below. Import is used for planting, and harvested plants are sent to export.

A distant cousin of the jeep, the Mk I {{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} electric rover is one of the most simple and durable light vehicles in the known universe. Able to carry two passengers and cargo such as the {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:Crate}, it is powered by up to three batteries, accepting everything including {THING:ItemBatteryCellNuclear}. A quad-array of hub-mounted electric engines propels the reinforced aluminium frame over most terrain and modest obstacles. While the Mk I is designed for stability in low-horizontality circumstances, if it rolls, try using your {THING:ItemCrowbar} to put it right way up.
Place a respawn point to set a player entry point to your base when loading in, or returning from the dead.
Creates a {THING:Rover_MkI}

{LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's} leading hydroponic lighting system, the GrowUp UV light supplements sunshine in low light or sun-distant conditions. The unit adds growability over the space of a grid, so requires proximate placement to work.
This kit produces an {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero} {THING:StructureGrowLight}.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureUprightWindTurbine}.

Norsec's basic wind turbine is an easily fabricated, rapidly deployed design that is strong enough to withstand the worst that environments can throw at it. While the wind turbine is optimized to produce power even on low atmosphere worlds (up to 200W), it performs best in denser environments. Output varies with wind speed, and during storms, may increase dramatically (up to 800W), so be careful to design your power networks with that in mind.

A more heavily reinforced version of the iconic {THING:DynamicCrate}, the Crate Mk II is resistant to incredibly high pressures and temperatures. Short of disposing of it in a black hole, the Mk II is about as safe as luggage gets.
This kit produces a {THING:CrateMkII}.

Used for making soups when combined with food in the {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Fairly high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.

Made using {THING:ItemCookedPumpkin} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Fairly high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}

Made using {THING:ItemCookedCorn} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Faily high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.

Diced organic material that is returned when food and organic matter is passed through the {THING:StructureRecycler} and {THING:StructureCentrifuge}. Can be burned in a {THING:StructureFurnace} into {THING:ItemCharcoal} for use in the {THING:StructureSolidFuelGenerator}.

The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero} hydroponics device is the ideal vessel for growing a range of {LINK:OrganicPage;plantlife}. It must be supplied with water using a pipe network, and sufficient light to generate photosynthesis. It can be automated using the {THING:StructureHarvie}. Note that unlike the {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray}, these cannot be placed consecutively as they are considered devices rather than pure pipes. They do, however, allow data interrogation for logic systems.

Charcoal is a lightweight, black carbon residue produced by heating {THING:ItemBiomass} in a {THING:StructureArcFurnace}. It contains less energy potential than {THING:ItemCoalOre}, but can be used as a basic fuel source. Charcoal can also be substituted for coal in {LINK:IngotPage;alloy} recipes.
This kit produces heavy duty solar panels that are resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
The Mk II mining belt is similar to the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, but has 13 slots instead of the basic 8, to increase the length of your mining trips. It also has space for two tools.

The Stationeers wind turbine was first designed by Norsec atmospheric engineers, looking to create a wind-driven power generation system that would operate even on exceedingly low atmosphere worlds. The ultra-light blades respond to exceedingly low atmospheric densities, while being strong enough to function even under huge strain in much more demanding environments. While the wind turbine is optimized to produce power (up to 500W) even on low atmosphere worlds, it performs best in denser environments. Output varies with wind speed and, during storms, may increase dramatically (up to 10,000W), so be careful to design your power networks with that in mind.
This kit produces a {THING:StructureWindTurbine}.
This kit produces a range of liquid pipes.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.

It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
It's all in the title - liquid pipes create pipe networks for the storage and transport of matter's second state: liquid.
Delicious and pure H20, refined from local sources as varied as Venusian ice and trans-Solar comets. Empty bottles can be refilled using the {THING:StructureWaterBottleFiller}.
As its somewhat uninspired name suggests, this device refills a {THING:ItemWaterBottle}, when connected to a liquid pipe network.

The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} KoolAuger converts various ices into their respective {LINK:GasPage;gases} and liquids. A remarkably smart and compact sublimation-melting unit, it produces gas or liquid depending on the ice being processed. The upper outlet is gas, the lower for liquid, and while you can attach any pipe you like to either outlet, it will only function if the correct network is attached. It will also only pass gas or liquid into a network if it is powered and turned on. If the KoolAuger is full, it will not accept any further ice until the gas or liquid contents is drained. In this state, it will flash a yellow error state on the activation switch.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureIceCrusher}.
An insulated version of the {THING:DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterWater}, you are able to store water in this {SLOT:GasCanister} without them gaining or losing temperature.

A simple heat exchanger, pipe radiators can be placed on pipes to shed or gain heat, depending on the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere. If the atmosphere is hotter, heat will be added to the liquid within the pipe network, and visa versa if colder. In a vacuum, heat will be radiated. The speed of heat gain or loss will depend on the liquid in question. Adding multiple radiators will speed up heat transfer.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureLiquidPipeRadiator}.
An empty, insulated liquid {SLOT:GasCanister}.
An insulated version of the {THING:DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterWater}, for storing liquids without them gaining or losing temperature.

This standard issue frictional adherence adjustor is a top of the line, bi-rotational model with a columnated uni-grip. It's definitely not just a screwdriver. Use it for construction and deconstruction of certain kits, and setting values on {LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic} units. The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.
Angles-be-gone with the trusty angle grinder. The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

{LINK:Recurso;Recurso's} entry-level crowbar is useful in a variety of everyday {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} settings, from opening {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl}s and unpowered {THING:StructureAirlock}s, to splatting pan-dimensional headcrabs, should the need arise. The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} Off-whirled Hand Drill has been a companion to {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} for decades. Essential for assembling and deconstructing various items and structures, regardless of gravity, pressure or temperature.

The handheld 'Topo' tri-cone rotary mining drill was made for one thing: quick digging. Modeled on a classic {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} zero-g design, it functions equally well in vacuum and atmosphere, with cemented carbide bits to increase resilience and bearing life, and reduce spalling. As Jenk Murtons once said, 'The Topo don't stopo.' The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

Wirecutters allow you to deconstruct various {LINK:StructurePage;structures}, as well as cross-lay cables when held in your non-active hand, and defuse explosives as needed. Wirecutters are stored in the {THING:ItemToolBelt}, along with other essential {LINK:ToolPage;tools}.

One of humanity's enduring contributions to the cosmos, the wrench represents the essence of our species. A simple, effective and spiritually barren tool, use it to build and deconstruct a variety of {LINK:StructurePage;structures} The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.

In the distant past, one of Earth's great champions taught a generation of 'Fix-It People' that duct tape was the answer to any problem. {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have demonstrated that this is truth holds strong, so long as the problem is a damaged {THING:ItemEvaSuit}, {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}, {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet}, or even a {THING:StructureSolarPanel}. To use on yourself: put duct tape in your active hand, hold RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON to automatically repair damage.

The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous silo module provides storage for {LINK:OrePage;ores} collected by the {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}, {LINK:OrePage;ices} collected by the {THING:StructureModularRocketIceMining} and 'space junk' salvaged by the {THING:StructureModularRocketScrapMining} . In other words, it holds up to 600 'medium-sized dry goods'. The silo module must be connected to a mining or salvage module by a correctly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for material to pass into the silo. The silo module must also be powered when on the launch pad. It is 'on' by default, but can be turned off with logic if needed. The module can also be attached to a {THING:StructureChuteInlet} in order to connect it to {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} networks. To extract resources from the silo module, you must set its state to 'OPEN' using logic.
Coming soon
Collects gas from space by magic.
Collects energy by electromagnetically capturing the solar wind. Stores it in the {THING:StructureRocketModuleBattery}. Coming soon

The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo.

The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous {LINK:OrePage;ore} miner harvests metallic ores from asteroids and planets in the local region of space. Its range - and therefore how much {LINK:OrePage;ore} it collects - is strictly determined by the rocket's fuel quantity. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo. It has two modes - active (1), and inactive (0), which should only be triggered when the rocket has arrived on the planet and is idle (mode 4).
Coming soon
The automation module completes the rocket. It passes logic to its respective components.

A uni-directional, multi-state conveyance solution, the coupling module is designed to interface between various mining and storage modules. It is essential for the function of the mining unit. When placed BELOW a mining module (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}), the DOWN coupler passes mined or harvested material (solid, liquid or gas) into the respective storage unit (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo}).

A uni-directional, multi-state conveyance solution, the coupling module is designed to interface between various mining and storage modules. It is essential for the function of the mining unit. When placed ABOVE a mining module (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}), the UP coupler passes mined or harvested material (solid, liquid or gas) into the respective storage unit (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo}).
Creates a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo}.
Creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}
Creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketAutomation}
Creates a {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}.

The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous ice miner is a purpose-built, robotic ice harvester, able to mine ice ores from asteroids and planets in the local region of space. Its range - and therefore how much ice {LINK:OrePage;ore} it collects - is strictly determined by the rocket's fuel quantity. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo. It has two modes - active (1), and inactive (0), which should only be triggered when the rocket has arrived on the planet and is idle (mode 4).
Creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketIceMining}.

The so-called {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} 'space junk' collector module is really a high-end automated salvaging unit, purpose designed to interface with the {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous rocket. It sweeps the local region of space for wrecks, abandoned space shipments, and other detritus. As such, it returns a fairly random assortment of items. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo.
Creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketScrapMining}.

The drain is a simple device, although not without a touch of mystery. When connected to power and activated, it drains liquid from a liquid network at a rate of 1 mol per tick. Handy if there's liquid you need ... gone.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureModularRocketGasMining}.

In typical {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} fashion, the A.R.M. gas mining module is a rapidly designed addition to a more sophisticated system by a company with very little concern for safety or reliability. The module will store mined gas in an empty {THING:StructureModularRocketFueltank01}, so long as it is connected by a {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureHeatExchangeLiquidtoGas}, {THING:StructureHeatExchangerLiquidtoLiquid} and {THING:StructureHeatExchangerGastoGas}.

The original specs for the N Series Flow-P heat exchanger were rumored to have been scrawled on the back of a burger receipt by a bored {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} designer riding up the Brazilian space elevator, but that hasn't stopped it becoming one of the most widely-copied heat exchanger designs in the Solar System. The 'N Flow-P' has four connections, allowing you to pass two liquid networks into the unit, which then works to equalize temperature across the two separate networks. As the N Flow-P is a passive system, it equalizes pressure across the entire of each individual network, unless connected to liquid management devices like a {THING:StructureLiquidVolumePump} or a {THING:StructureBackLiquidPressureRegulator}.

The original specs for the N Series Flow-P heat exchanger were rumored to have been scrawled on the back of a burger receipt by a bored {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} designer riding up the Brazilian space elevator, but that hasn't stopped it becoming one of the most widely-copied heat exchanger designs in the Solar System. The 'N Flow-P' has four connections, allowing you to pass two gas networks into the unit, which then works to equalize temperature across the two separate networks. As the N Flow-P is a passive system, it equalizes pressure across the entire of each individual network, unless connected to gas management devices like a {THING:StructureVolumePump} or a {THING:StructureBackPressureRegulator}.

The original specs for the N Series Flow-P heat exchanger were rumored to have been scrawled on the back of a burger receipt by a bored {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} designer riding up the Brazilian space elevator, but that hasn't stopped it becoming one of the most widely-copied heat exchanger designs in the Solar System. The 'N Flow-P' has four connections, allowing you to pass separate liquid and gas networks into the unit, which then works to equalize temperature across the two separate networks. As the N Flow-P is a passive system, it equalizes pressure across the entire of each individual network, unless connected to devices like a {THING:StructureVolumePump} or a {THING:StructureBackLiquidPressureRegulator}.

The {LINK:ODA;ODA} does not approve of soundtracks or other distractions. As such, {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have had to create their own musical accompaniment to the demanding labor of building and maintaining off-world infrastructure. Central to this pastime is the step sequencer, which allows Stationeers to sequence short musical patterns or loops.
{HEADER:DIY MUSIC - GETTING STARTED}
1: Connect 8 {THING:DeviceStepUnit}s to your step sequencer via the data port on the left hand side.
2: Label each step unit, then assign step units 1 through 8 on the step sequencer using the screwdriver.
3: Select the output speaker (eg {THING:PassiveSpeaker}) where the sequencer will play the sounds. This needs to be connected to the logic network on the right hand side of the sequencer.
4: Place a {THING:StopWatch} and use a {THING:StructureLogicReader} and {THING:StructureLogicWriter} to write the time to the time variable on the sequencer.
5: Set the BPM on the sequencer using a {THING:StructureLogicDial} and a {THING:StructureLogicWriter} to write to the sequencer's BPM variable. A higher bpm will play the sequence faster.
6: Insert a sound cartridge of your choosing and select which variant of sound you wish to play by pushing the arrow buttons located above and below the sound cartridge slot.
7: Choose the pitch of the sounds to play by setting the dial on each of your 8 step units to the desired note. With drums, each note is a different drum sounds. You can trial your sounds by pushing the activate button on each step unit (with the sequencer inactive).
8: Get freaky with the {THING:DeviceLfoVolume}.
9: Finally, activate the sequencer, Vibeoneer.

When your {LINK:OrganicPage;food} decays, it turns into this. {LINK:ODA;ODA} scientists have attempted to determine the exact constituents of this substance, but it remains evasive and mysterious. Suffice to say, eating it is a bad idea. Research has determined, however, that The exact speed of decay varies individually by:
- TEMPERATURE - Refrigeration will slow decay, but many foods will be damaged by exposure to extreme low pressure, as well as extreme heat. The optimum temperature is 0 kelvin (-272 C).
- FOOD TYPE - Each {LINK:OrganicPage;food} type has its own decay properties. {THING:ItemTomatoSoup} lasts a lot longer than a {THING:ItemTomato}, for instance.
- PRESSURE - Food decays faster when the pressure drops below 1 atmosphere (101kPa). Decay happens exponentially more quickly as the atmosphere approaches a perfect vacuum. There is no effect from higher pressures.
- ATMOSPHERE - Different gases can slow and accelerate the decay process. The process will take account of respective gas ratios in mixed atmospheres in calculating the decay modifier. The following rates apply across all foods:
> {GAS:Oxygen} x 1.3 > {GAS:Nitrogen} x 0.6 > {GAS:CarbonDioxide} x 0.8 > {GAS:Volatiles} x 1 > {GAS:Pollutant} x 3 > {GAS:NitrousOxide} x 1.5 > {GAS:Water} x 2 > Vacuum (see PRESSURE above)
A shelf for putting things on, so you can see them.

The low frequency oscillator (or LFO) makes everything sound dark, twisted and crunchy by altering the shape of the waves output by a {THING:LogicStepSequencer8}.
To set up an LFO:
1. Place the LFO unit 2. Set the LFO output to a {THING:PassiveSpeaker} 2. Set a sequencers' output to LFO - so the sequencer's signal runs through the LFO to a speaker. 3. Place a {THING:StopWatch} or use an existing one, then use a {THING:StructureLogicWriter} to write it to the LFO. 4. Use another logic writer to write the BPM to the LFO. 5. You are ready. This is the future. You're in space. Make it sound cool.
For more info, check out the {LINK:MusicPage;music page}.

The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Koolaid fridge is a self-cooling storage device with 15 slots that preserves food when powered and turned on. While many users have complained about the placement of the power switch, its place in the pantheon of off-world whiteware is unquestioned.
With its own permanent internal atmosphere, the Koolaid fridge slows the decay of {LINK:OrganicPage;food} by maintaining an optimal internal temperature. Its power usage varies on the external temperature against which it must balance its internal temperature. As such, it must shed heat to operate, so the Koolaid fridge DOES NOT work in a vacuum.
Also, don't leave the door open, as it will equalize with the current world temperature. And maybe start to beep.
For more information about food preservation, visit the {LINK:DecayPage;food decay} section of the Stationpedia.
This kit creates a {THING:StructureFridgeBig}.

Essentially a heavily insulated box that allows users to pipe in any desired atmosphere, the {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} Minibar fridge was a simple solution to the problem of {LINK:NutritionPage;food decay}. It stores a small number of items, at any temperature you can muster.
For more information about food preservation, visit the {LINK:DecayPage;food decay} section of the Stationpedia.

The refrigerated OmniKool vending machine is an advanced version of the standard {THING:StructureVendingMachine}, which maintains an optimum pressure and constant temperature of -130 degrees C, to prevent food spoilage. It can hold up to 100 stacks. The OmniKool also has an in-built {THING:StructureStacker}, allowing players to set the stack sizes of any items ADDED to the device. The unit's default stack size is 50. NOTE: altering stack sizes DOES NOT update existing stacks within the machine, only those subsequently added.
Grow a {THING:ItemPotato}.
Grow a {THING:ItemCorn}.
Grow some {THING:ItemWheat}.
Grow a {THING:ItemTomato}.
Grow some {THING:ItemSoybean}.
Grow some {THING:ItemRice}.
Grow a {THING:ItemPumpkin}.
Grow a {THING:ItemFern}.
Grow a {THING:ItemMushroom}.

Fertilizer alters plant growth processes, and is created by the basic composter and the {THING:StructureAdvancedComposter} using {LINK:OrganicPage;organic} matter. Fertilizer's affects depend on its ingredients:
- {LINK:OrganicPage;Food} increases PLANT YIELD up to two times - {THING:DecayedFood} increases plant GROWTH SPEED up to two times - {THING:ItemBiomass} increases the NUMBER OF GROWTH CYCLES the fertilizer lasts for
The effect of these ingredients depends on their respective proportions in the composter when processing is activated.

The advanced composter creates {THING:Fertilizer} out of organic matter. It accepts {LINK:OrganicPage;food}, {THING:DecayedFood} or {THING:ItemBiomass}. It requires {GAS:Water} and power to operate, accelerating the natural composting process. When processing, it releases nitrogen and volatiles, as well a small amount of heat.
{HEADER:Compost composition} Fertilizer is produced at a 1:3 ratio of fertilizer to ingredients. The fertilizer's effects on plants will vary depending on the respective proportions of its ingredients.
- {LINK:OrganicPage;Food} increases PLANT YIELD up to two times - {THING:DecayedFood} increases plant GROWTH SPEED up to two times - {THING:ItemBiomass} increases the NUMBER OF GROWTH CYCLES the fertilizer lasts for up to five times
Creates an {THING:StructureAdvancedComposter}.
Creates a {THING:StructureFridgeSmall}.
A small planter for decorative or hydroponic purposes. Can be connected to {GAS:Water}, or watered manually using a {THING:ItemWaterBottle} or {THING:ItemGasCanisterWater}.
Places a {THING:StructurePlanter}.

A simple composting device, the basic composter creates {THING:Fertilizer} out of organic matter. It accepts {LINK:OrganicPage;food}, {THING:DecayedFood} or {THING:ItemBiomass}. It requires a full {THING:ItemLiquidCanisterEmpty} and a battery to operate, accelerating the natural composting process. When processing, it releases nitrogen and volatiles, as well a small amount of heat.
{HEADER:Compost composition} Fertilizer is produced at a 1:3 ratio of fertilizer to ingredients. The fertilizer's effects on plants will vary depending on the respective proportions of its ingredients.
- {LINK:OrganicPage;food} increases PLANT YIELD up to two times - {THING:DecayedFood} increases plant GROWTH SPEED up to two times - {THING:ItemBiomass} increases the NUMBER OF GROWTH CYCLES the fertilizer lasts for

The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Cannifier requires {THING:ItemEmptyCan} and cooked {LINK:OrganicPage;food} to create {LINK:DecayPage;long-lasting}, easily stored sustenance. Note that the Cannifier must be bolted to a {THING:StructureBench} for power, and only accepts cooked food and tin cans.
{HEADER:OPERATION}
1. Add the correct ingredients to the device via the hopper in the TOP.
2. Close the device using the dropdown handle.
3. Activate the device.
4. Remove canned goods from the outlet in the FRONT.
Note: the Cannifier will flash an error on its activation switch if you attempt to activate it before closing it.

Made in an {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine} or {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine}, using {THING:ItemCookedMushroom} and a {THING:ItemEmptyCan}, delicious mushroom soup is fairly high in nutrition, and does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.
Powdered eggs: the reason you went to space.
Because space would suck without 'em.

Made in an {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine} or {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine}, using {THING:ItemCookedRice} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan}, canned rice pudding is a sweet treat, fairly high in nutrition, and does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.

Made in an {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine} or {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine}, using {THING:ItemCookedCondensedMilk} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan}, canned condensed milk is fairly high in nutrition, and does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.

Made in an {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine} or {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine}, using {THING:ItemCookedSoybean} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan}, canned edamame beans are fairly high in nutrition, and do not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.

Made in an {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine} or {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine}, using {THING:ItemCookedPowderedEggs} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan}, canned powdered eggs are an exciting, dynamic food that's fairly high in nutrition, and does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.

The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Advanced Cannifier Multi-Plus Pro is an automateable packaging machine that uses {THING:ItemEmptyCan}s and cooked {LINK:OrganicPage;food} to create canned sustenance that does not decay. Note that the ACMPP only accepts cooked food and tin cans.

A larger and more capacious mining belt, the Mk II is similar to the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, but has 13 slots instead of the basic 8, to increase the length of your mining trips. It also has space for two tools.

For those special, private moments, a window that can be closed to prying eyes.
When closed, has the heat transfer characteristics of a basic wall. Requires power, and can be connected to logic systems.
Produces a {THING:StructureWindowShutter}.

The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} OGRE (Orthogonal Ground Rotating Excavator) is a base structure with attached mining vehicle, which will mine a horizontal shaft up to X meters long. When full, the mining vehicle will return to the base to empty itself, before returning to dig. If it encounters empty space, it will also return to base and await instruction. The unit will return if deactivated.
The OGRE can be connected to a chute system, and is controllable by a logic network. Note that the OGRE outputs more {LINK:OrePage;ore} than a conventional {THING:ItemMiningDrill} over the same area, due to more efficient processing.
{HEADER:MODES} Idle - 0 Mining - 1 Returning - 2 DepostingOre - 3 Finished - 4
Enjoy vistas of even the most savage, alien landscapes with these heavy duty window frames, which are resistant to pressure differentials up to 1MPa.

The Laptop functions as a portable IC editor. To operate the Laptop it must be powered with a battery, have a {THING:MotherboardProgrammableChip} in the motherboard slot, and an {THING:ItemIntegratedCircuit10} in the Programmable Chip Slot.
You must place the laptop down to interact with the onsreen UI.

{LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's} Winterspawn atmospheric bio-processor is a recent addition to their catalog of genespliced environmental decorations. Using ambient heat to split {GAS:Water} into {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}, the Winterspawn cools its surroundings, when supplied with sufficient {GAS:Nitrogen}. The alpha variant has a peak cooling and electrolysis capacity of 90Watts and is most efficient operating in air temperatures of 0 to 40 Degrees Celsius.

{LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's} Winterspawn atmospheric bio-processor is a recent addition to their catalog of genespliced environmental decorations. Using ambient heat to split {GAS:Water} into {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}, the Winterspawn cools its surroundings when supplied with sufficient {GAS:Nitrogen}. The beta variant has a peak cooling and electrolysis capacity of 150Watts and is most efficient operating in air temperatures of 14 to 24 Degrees Celsius.

The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's}-created Hades Flower is the result of as dubious experiment to combine the allure of tropical plants with the comfort and homeliness of a heat pump. The plant breathes a 1:3 mix of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}, and exhales heated {GAS:Pollutant}.

The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's}-created Hades Flower is the result of as dubious experiment to combine the allure of tropical plants with the comfort and homeliness of a heat pump. The plant breathes a 1:3 mix of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}, and exhales heated {GAS:Pollutant}. The beta strain is notably more efficient than the earlier, more experimental alpha variant.
Creates a {THING:StructureStirlingEngine}.

Harnessing an ancient thermal exploit, the {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} 'Libra' Stirling Engine generates power via the expansion and contraction of a working gas to drive pistons operating an electrical generator.
When high pressure hot gas is supplied into the input pipe, this gas will heat the hot side of the unit, then pass into the output pipe. The cooler side uses the room's ambient atmosphere, which must be kept at a lower temperature and pressure in order to create a differential. Add a working gas by inserting a {SLOT:GasCanister}. The unit must be deactivated when adding or removing canisters, or the working gas may leak into the surrounding atmosphere.
Gases with a low molecular mass make the most efficient working gases. Increasing the moles of working gas can result in a greater potential power output. However, overpressuring the unit may have ... sub-optimal results.

The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} Wireless Power Transmitter is an uni-directional, A-to-B, far field microwave electrical transmission system.The rotatable base transmitter delivers a narrow, non-lethal microwave beam to a dedicated base receiver. The transmitter must be aligned to the base station in order to transmit any power. The brightness of the transmitter's collimator arc provides an indication of transmission intensity. Note that there is an attrition over longer ranges, so the unit requires more power over greater distances to deliver the same output.

The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} Wireless Power Transmitter is an uni-directional, A-to-B, far field microwave electrical transmission system.The rotatable base transmitter delivers a narrow, non-lethal microwave beam to a dedicated base receiver. The transmitter must be aligned to the base station in order to transmit any power. The brightness of the transmitter's collimator arc provides an indication of transmission intensity. Note that there is an attrition over longer ranges, so the unit requires more power over greater distances to deliver the same output.
Creates {THING:StructureLargeExtendableRadiator}.

Omptimised for radiating heat in vacuum and low pressure environments. If pointed at the sun it will heat its contents rapidly via solar heating. The panels can fold away to stop all heat radiation/solar heating and protect them from storms.

Nitrice is the nickname given to solid {GAS:Nitrogen} Ice, and found on many planets and moons in the Solar System. Given the inert nature of the {GAS:Nitrogen} it produces, the ice is useful when making breathable atmospheres with low flammability.
Highly sensitive to temperature, nitrice will begin to melt as soon as it is mined, unless the temperature is below zero, or it is stored in the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, {THING:ItemMiningBeltAdvanced} or devices like the {THING:StructureIceCrusher} or {THING:StructureFridgeSmall}.
Creates {THING:StructureMediumRadiator} and {THING:StructureMediumConvectionRadiator}.
Has been replaced by {THING:StructureMediumConvectionRadiator}.
Creates {THING:StructureMediumRadiator} and {THING:StructureMediumConvectionRadiator}.
Creates {THING:StructureMediumRadiatorLiquid} and {THING:StructureMediumConvectionRadiatorLiquid}.

A {LINK:LogicPage;logic} device that performs a logical operation on one or more binary inputs that produces a single binary output. An input greater than zero is considered true for operations.

This device is used to create {GAS:NitrousOxide} from {GAS:Oxygen}, {GAS:Nitrogen}, and a large amount of energy. The process does not completely transform all the available gas at once, so the output is a mix of all three gasses, which may need further processing. More NOS will be created, if the gas inside the machine is close to a 1/1 ratio of Oxygen to Nitrogen. The second gas input line in optional, and not required if the gas is pre mixed.

Adapted slightly from its original {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} design, the {GAS:Volatiles} Combustor does exactly what its name suggests - it burns a mixture of volatiles and {GAS:Oxygen} to create water. Extremely useful in hot or arid environments, users need to be aware that the combustor outputs considerable waste heat. The device is also less than perfectly efficient, resulting in the autoignition of volatiles in the chamber, and the production of waste gases which must be dealt with.
A pipe mounted radiator optimized for radiating heat in vacuums and low pressure environments.
A liquid pipe mounted radiator optimized for radiating heat in vacuums and low pressure environments.
A stand-alone radiator unit optimized for exchanging heat with its surrounding atmosphere.
A stand-alone radiator unit optimized for radiating heat in vacuums and low pressure environments.
A stand-alone liquid radiator unit optimized for radiating heat in vacuums and low pressure environments.
A stand-alone liquid radiator unit optimized for exchanging heat with its surrounding atmosphere.

This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeRadiatorFlatLiquid} and {THING:StructureLiquidPipeRadiator}.
The vertical variant of the cryo tube. Will heal players and organs as well as revive dead players when provided with an atmosphere of NOS below -150C.
The horizontal variant of the cryo tube. Will heal players and organs as well as revive dead players when provided with an atmosphere of NOS below -150C.
Drills through terrain until it hits bedrock. Once inside bedrock {THING:ItemDirtyOre} is produced every roughly every 90s
The vertical variant of the sleeper. Will keep players hydrated and fed while they are logged out - as long as a breathable atmosphere is provided.
A horizontal variant of the sleeper. Will keep players hydrated and fed while they are logged out - as long as a breathable atmosphere is provided.
A horizontal variant of the sleeper. Will keep players hydrated and fed while they are logged out - as long as a breathable atmosphere is provided.

Will be triggered if there is a player in the range of the sensor (as defined by the setting dial). The quantity variable will show the number of players. You can configure the sensor to only detect players who hold the correct Access Card using a {THING:CartridgeAccessController} in a {THING:ItemTablet}.

Will be triggered if there is a player in the same room as the sensor. The quantity variable will show the number of players. You can use configure it to only detect players who hold the correct Access Card using a {THING:CartridgeAccessController} in a {THING:ItemTablet}. This sensor only works when placed in a room.
Creates {THING:StructureDeepMiner} which can drill through the terrain into bedrock to mine {THING:ItemDirtyOre}

Ore mined from bedrock via the {THING:StructureDeepMiner} which then can be used in the {THING:StructureCentrifuge}, or {THING:StructureCombustionCentrifuge}. Once processed, it produces ore in a ratio similar to the average found on the planet's surface.
A chute that toggles between two outputs
The Chute Valve will stop the flow of materials when set to closed and when set to open, will act like a straight chute.

The Combustion Centrifuge is a gas powered version of the {THING:StructureCentrifuge}. A combustible fuel mix should be supplied to the gas input, and waste gasses should be vented from the output. The machine's RPMs must be controlled via the throttle and combustion limiter levers. If the Combustion Centrifuge gains, or looses, RPMs too fast it will experience stress, and eventually grind to a halt. Higher RPMs directly result in faster processing speeds. The throttle lever controls the amount of fuel being pulled into the machine, increasing the temperature inside the engine, and leading to an increase in RPM. The limiter lever influences the speed of the combustion, and how much uncombusted gas is in the exhaust. Ejecting ore from the Combustion Centrifuge while it is at high RPMs will result in additional stress build up. If turned off while not stressed, the machine will automatically start to brake, and reduce RPMs in a controlled manner.
The overflow chute will direct materials to its overflow port when the thing connected to its default port is already occupied.

The Digital Chute Valve will stop the flow of materials when set to closed and when set to open, will act like a straight chute. The valve will automatically close after a certain number of items have passed through. This threshold can be set using the dial.

The Digital Chute Valve will stop the flow of materials when set to closed and when set to open, will act like a straight chute. The valve will automatically close after a certain number of items have passed through. This threshold can be set using the dial.

RecordThing.Description: The digital flip flop will toggle between two outputs using a specified ratio (n:1). For example, setting the dial to 2 would allow two items to pass through the primary output before flipping to the secondary output.

RecordThing.Description: The digital flip flop will toggle between two outputs using a specified ratio (n:1). For example, setting the dial to 2 would allow two items to pass through the primary output before flipping to the secondary output.
This kit produces a variety of powered chutes

The Plant Sampler allows you to take a {LINK:GeneticsPage;gene} sample of a growing plant. The sampler can then be placed in the {THING:AppliancePlantGeneticAnalyzer} to attain and interpret the results.

The Genetic Analyzer can be used to process samples from the {THING:ItemPlantSampler}. Once processed, the genetic information of the sampled plant can be viewed by clicking on the search button.
Individual Gene Value Widgets: Most gene values will appear as a sliding bar between a minimum value on the left and a maximum value on the right. The actual value of the gene is in the middle of the bar, in orange.
Multiple Gene Value Widgets: For temperature and pressure ranges, four genes appear on the same widget. The orange values underneath the bar are the minimum and maximum thresholds for growth. Outside of this range, the plant will stop growing and eventually die. The blue values underneath the bar are the minimum and maximum thresholds for ideal growth. Inside of this range, the plant will grow at maximum speed. The white values above the bar are the minimum and maximum achievable values for the growth threshold.

The Genetic Stabilizer can be used to manipulate gene stability on a specific {LINK:OrganicPage;Plants} or {LINK:OrganicPage;Seeds}. It has two modes Stabilize and Destabilize. Stabilize: Increases all genes stability by 50%. Destabilize: Decreases all gene stability by 10% other than a chosen gene which will received decreased stability by 50%.

The Genetic Splicer can be used to copy a single {LINK:GeneticsPage;gene} from one 'source' plant to another 'target' plant of the same type. After copying, the source plant will be destroyed.
To begin splicing, place a plant or seed bag in the left slot (source) and place another plant or seed bag of the same type in the right slot (target). You can select a gene using the arrow buttons. Close the sliding door and press the green activate button. Once splicing has begun, the device will be locked until the process has finished (which will take approximately twenty minutes). If you want to cancel splicing you can power off the bench or detach the appliance as a last resort.
The seed tray can hold up to twelve plants or seeds and can be used to facilitate fast experimentation and testing of plant genetics.
The target point where the trader shuttle will land. Requires a clear view of the sky.
Extends the size of the landing pad area. A basic trader shuttle requires a 3x3 clear landing area.
Extends the size of the landing pad area. A basic trader shuttle requires a 3x3 clear landing area.
Extends the size of the landing pad area. A basic trader shuttle requires a 3x3 clear landing area.
Provides power to the landing pad. The data port must be connected to the data port of a computer with a communications motherboard for a trader to be called in to land.
Increases the volume of the landing pads gas storage capacity. This volume is used for buying and selling gas to traders.
Pumps gas purchased from a trader out of the landing pad. You can increase the landing pad's gas storage capacity by adding more {THING:Landingpad_GasCylinderTankPiece} to the landing pad.
Pumps liquid purchased from a trader out of the landing pad. You can increase the landing pad's liquid storage capacity by adding more {THING:Landingpad_GasCylinderTankPiece} to the landing pad.

This small communications unit can be used to communicate with nearby trade vessels.
When connected to a {THING:StructureComputer} containing a {THING:MotherboardComms} motherboard, a {THING:Landingpad_CenterPiece01}, and a {THING:StructureVendingMachine}, this allows Stationeers to contact traders. Adjust its horizontal and vertical attributes either directly or through logic.

Loulan, upon arrival you will notice a breathable atmosphere, high enough pressure to sustain life - but a severe lack of it. This sandy giant is situated in the Gargantuan System, moving closer to the black hole situated in the center each day. While abandoned and no longer green and full of {GAS:Water}, this planet still has a functioning atmosphere and you are tasked with scouring the wasteland to acquire the materials and resources needed to survive on this everlasting desert.

So you're stuck on the moon, but it's not all bad.Sure, it's cold, harsh and pretty monotonous, but at least the sun's shining. The solar panel is going to be useful, and the power controller... and probably the arc furnace too. There's even a little food and oxygen in the other crates, though it's definitely not going to last forever. Neither's your battery. You better start thinking about how you're going to survive. How hard could it be to rig up an airlock? A generator? Maybe even smelt some ore and build yourself a base? Looks like you're gonna be here a while.

This is Stationeers Creative Mode!Spawn in any item, test ideas and build bonkers stuff real fast. <color=red>This mode is experimental. Think of it as a freeform space party where exciting and unexpected things* can and will happen, compared to the more reliable near-death experience of Survival Mode. Just don't be sad when you blow yourself into tiny, tiny little pieces or get savaged by chickens or slowly explode while drifting alone into the infinite void. *bugs
Satellites suggest a crate has dropped nearby, your beacon tracker should show you the way.

A desolate dusty red ball, Mars features more varied terrain that can reach into the sky, and a chilly atmosphere that's no good for breathing, but maybe it can be used for something ...

While the presence of coal isn't typical of Earth's Moon, the relatively flat terrain full of various sizable craters and lack of atmosphere may be more familiar in this grey landscape. A great location for the budding Stationeer to begin their journey, with fewer of the hazards and complexities offered on more exotic worlds
While there's no gravity or atmosphere, at least there's a lot of space to build! You'll find yourself among several asteroids that may contain various ores and ices you can use to survive out here.

Unvarying extreme temperatures and ultra-high pressures make Venus no place for the faint-hearted. Only the most accomplished Stationeers will survive on our once-sister planet, now a barren rock. Dig deep, or go home.

Melting some of the ice on this cold world has finally given it an atmosphere, but it's extremely frigid environment presents a serious challenge for the stationeers.The extreme cold will cause batteries to rapidly lose power, so getting a steady power source and warm location are your priorities.
The volatile environment on Vulcan is surviable for very few living organisms, but it's fractured surface and rich mineral deposits make it a risky but profitable venture for enterprising traders.

A world torn apart due to massive tidal forces from the supermassive black hole it orbits. Vulcan offers little hope for any organism that ends up here, but it's fractured surface and rich mineral deposits make it a risky but profitable venture for enterprising traders.Watch out for the deep crevasses that lead to deadly magma flows beneath the surface!

A barren rock nestled under the wing of Saturn's spectacular rings. Mimas tiny stature is reflected in its extremely low gravity, and the Mimantean surface is saturated with impact craters from wayward ring occupants. It's distance from the sun provides little power from solar devices.Be very careful when walking or jumping, as you can travel a long way and gain a lot of speed due to the extremely low gravity.

Whether driven by concerns for clarity, safety or simple aesthetics, {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have access to a small rainbow of colors for their constructions. These are the color setting for devices, represented as an integer.
0: Blue 1: Grey 2: Green 3: Orange 4: Red 5: Yellow 6: White 7: Black 8: Brown 9: Khaki 10: Pink 11: Purple
It is an unwavering universal law that anything higher than 11 will be purple. The {LINK:ODA;ODA} is powerless to change this. Similarly, anything lower than 0 will be Blue.

Agrizero is an agricultural biotech firm focused on researching and deploying offworld farming technology. The company’s aim is to provide a network of self-sustaining, self-contained 'bio-factories' that will ultimately feed a projected 1 million humans in space. Emerging from the late 21st century's environmental disasters, the firm has roots in China's world-saving artificial farming initiatives, and has now spread to facilities in the Asteroid Belt, where the supply of ice asteroids makes vertical farming and controlled-environment agriculture extremely promising. While many of their facilities are still under construction, Agrizero is already one of the main suppliers of offworld groups like {LINK:ODA;ODA}, {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} and {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} through the ever-expanding Trader Network.

Asura Biomedia was founded in the early 22nd century by Mumbai-based trillionaire Ashan Gurwaja. Nominally focused on 'biotechnology', the company has always had an ‘elastic’ notion of exactly what that entailed: everything from pharmaceuticals to pet food. Gurwaja's background in bio-engineering firms put the company in the highest echelon of bio-science industries from the very beginning, and it grew exactly as its founder intended: rapidly and reliably, structured specifically to swallow up any smaller firms in its way. Near mid-century, Asura's ambitions evolved to embrace entire health systems – it is now the largest provider of healthcare on Earth, integrating hospitals and primary care with medical supplies, pharmaceutical production and retail, residential care and funeral services. By 2150, Asura's business was a simple proposition, as captured in their famous – if not infamous – advertising slogan: 'We're in you'.

Founded in 2085 to produce weapons for {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}'s space forces, the company is known for making highly reliable and affordable weapons for off-world use. Their pragmatic approach is reflected in their focus on designs suitable for 3D printing and mass production, as well as a high reuse of components across models and weapon classes. As a result, although CHAC guns excel in no particular category, and have certainly never been accused of gretness, they suffer no great failings, and perform sufficiently well by most known measures to have earned their designers the informal title of 'armorer to the Solar System'.

In the aftermath of the Sisyphus disaster on Mars in 2079, asteroid shifting was officially banned by the {LINK:ODA;ODA}. This sea-change forced the newborn space mining industry to reconsider its strategies, but until the opening of the Manaus Space Elevator, marginal economics meant offworld resource extraction was effectively impossible. Formed in 2095 by a long-standing Swiss-German mining conglomerate and a consortium of other interests, ExMin was more an idea than a commercial reality for several decades. Created with the certainty that a space elevator would eventually arrive, ExMin was one of the first to exploit the access it offered. Subsequently it has become one of the Solar System's most powerful commercial entities. With access to space secure, ExMin became a central player in the flow of resources to the Inner System. It has competition, principally from Brazilian mining giant {LINK:Recurso;Recurso}, but the company has never entirely lost its lead on off-world mining. Synonymous with rare earth metals and pioneering off-world resource extraction, it stands at the forefront of development throughout the Solar System.

Officially known as Gewehrfabrik GmbH, GeFabrik is one of the world’s oldest and most highly regarded armament firms, known for producing exceptionally accurate, high-end firearms. In the wake of the European arms manufacturing collapse in the 2030s, a group of unemployed armament staff formed GeFabrik. Dedicated to renewing original design principles, the company is legendary for extensive testing, sometimes lasting as long as 10 years, in order to produce ‘ganz’ weapon formats. GeFabrik is widely regarded as having single-handedly salvaged Germany's manufacturing reputation, while doing nothing for their sense of humor.

Founded by Noboru Hiiragi in the aftermath of the 2110s economic bubble, Hiiragi Communications absorbed several prominent offworld assets, quickly becoming the most widely used trans-Solar System communications network. If you’ve communicated with friends and family offworld recently, it’s been through the Hiiragi network, even if it’s been branded under one of its many child companies. Hiiragi is also the number one seller for PCD’s (Personal Communication Devices) as well as a deep, if difficult to assess investor in terrestrial telecommunication networks.

With its roots in early 20th Century defense industry, Norsec (a.k.a. Northern Security Systems) was an early adopter of asteroid mining – one of its tugs being involved in the infamous Sisyphus Hit on the fledgling Martian colony at Sanders. Norsec was officially cleared of any wrong-doing, but when the {LINK:ODA;ODA} banned asteroidal relocation, the company shifted its focus to infrastructure and manufacturing. Norsec’s orbitally-based Space Systems Division is responsible for the design and production of {LINK:ODA;ODA}’s core transport systems, while also being rumoured to hold a large interest in {LINK:ExMin;ExMin}. The company is also noted for its willingness to engage in experimental robotic technology.

In the aftermath of the Earth Crisis, humanity’s focus on space diminished. Yet many felt that, without ambitions beyond our home planet, our species might falter. Created in 2070CE by a newly revamped United Nations, the Offworld Development Agency was given a very specific goal - to guide and encourage human space exploration at a time the cosmos was fading from the public mind. It inaugurated the {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} Program in 2095. Understanding that funding would be difficult to come by, the ODA conceived the program as a slow-burn, low-outlay space initiative. While some derided Stationeers as 'cut-price cosmic castaways', the success of the program is testament to the wisdom and pragmatism of ODA's vision.

This long-standing Brazilian mining group branched into space in the late 21st century. Focused primarily on bulk minerals and metals, the company is perhaps best understood as an extension of the Brazilian government – very few upper echelon political figures in modern Brazil are not implicated in one arm or another of this industrial behemoth. Enmeshment with South American politics has given the company heavy influence over the Manaus space elevator. This deep state control has led to other groups – the {LINK:ODA;ODA} included – to exercise a certain ‘flexibility’ toward Recurso. Accusations of illegal asteroid relocation, safety violations and numerous commercial infringements have barely touched it. Meanwhile, defenders point out that very little has been proven in court, and Recurso is hardly alone – hence the truism: 'In space, we all live in glass houses.'

The sole 'traditional' state entity to survive offworld politics, Sinotai’s reach and power is second only to the {LINK:ODA;ODA} itself. In many ways a relic – a sub-agency of a staggeringly complicated Earth-bound corporate-bureaucracy – its structure has allowed Sinotai to achieve incredible things. Proving its mettle in the early 21st Century by putting the first humans on Mars, establishing the first offworld gigawatt power system, and the first space-borne fuel refinery, few space-going organisations lack some degree of relationship with Sinotai. A common joke has it that it's impossible to do anything in space without them. Regardless of the truth, Sinotai's approach to off-world development has involved a 'soft power' approach, from MOU's with {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} (giving them preferential access to the Manaus space elevator) to murkier alliances of convenience with a range of Trader groups.

Originally a defense contractor specializing in brute force, high power weaponry, Tanzanian Kinetic Systems executed a large-scale, peace-time pivot to become the African Assembly’s leading designer of high-speed goods conveyors. Now producing a range of chute network designs and components, TK has a strong offworld presence as a result of the Afro-Sino partnerships in the latter 21st Century. Based in the ‘reconned’ Kigamboni district of Dar E Salaam, the Company regularly enters into development partnerships with {LINK:CHAC;CHAC} and, as a result, many of their products show distinct similarities. After all, what is a gun but a ‘high speed goods conveyor’.

A 2150CE survey revealed the Xigo 'X' as one of the most recognized symbols in the world. Yet few participants could clearly describe the company's actual scope. Precisely where the company begins and ends has been the subject of endless theories, financial studies and lawsuits – originally a website for price comparisons, the conglomerate expanded to embrace data, then distribution and finally production. It was a seemingly indiscriminate expansion, focused not on one industry, but all of them – taking in so many fields that business analysts have largely rejected the idea of Xigo as a single entity. Rather, it is a conceptual grouping for a branch of human activity. And while such statistics are – by their very nature – difficult to confirm, recent estimates suggest Xigo employs over 1.5% of the entire human race. Suffice to say, it produces almost everything.

In the early 22nd century, Earth was emerging from a cataclysm. Its resources eroded, our population reduced, rebuilding was the spirit of the era. Initiated by the {LINK:ODA;Offworld Development Agency} (ODA) in 2095CE, the Stationeers Program was dedicated to a single ideal: keeping humanity pointed at the stars. Stationeers are everything: astronauts, engineers and explorers, deployed with limited equipment and tools, trained to do more with less. Turning the environment to their advantage, their job is to provide infrastructure for humans in space, at a fraction of the cost of traditional space programs. Able to build and maintain bases anywhere from the Moon to Mimas and beyond, Stationeers are our vanguard in the cosmos. Schooled in offworld survival, mining and construction techniques, basic metallurgy, electronics, rocketry, hydroponics and more ‘arcane’ sciences, Stationeers do what they must to survive, and thrive. Renowned for having no entry criteria, there is no such thing as a ‘typical’ Stationeer. Psychological profiling suggests successful Cadets show a ‘baseline’ pragmatism and single-mindedness, but some of the most famous Stationeers possess neither of these qualities. Recruiting from civil engineering backgrounds, military and aerospace industries, software development, mining groups, as well as scientific fields and even religious orders, the Stationeers Program is – fundamentally – open to all humanity.

Oxygen provides energy when released in combustion, and also bonds with hydrogen to create {GAS:Water}. It is created by {LINK:OrganicPage;plants}, as well as from processing {THING:ItemOxite}. It is highly flammable at low temperatures.

{GAS:Nitrogen} can be mixed with {GAS:Oxygen} to stabilize its flammability and avoid {GAS:Oxygen} toxicity, and is a resource in its own right, useful for creating, a breathable atmosphere (at roughly 3:1 {GAS:Nitrogen} and {GAS:Oxygen}). The most efficient source of {GAS:Nitrogen} is from {THING:ItemNitrice} deposites found around the Solar System.

You breathe it out, {LINK:OrganicPage;plants} breath it in. They don't grow without it. You can use items placed in {SLOT:GasFilter} slots to remove this from the atmosphere.
{GAS:CarbonDioxide} has a moderately high specific heat, meaning it makes a good coolant for devices like the Wall Coo {THING:StructureWallCooler}. {GAS:Water} is better, but usually has more important uses.

Volatiles are an extremely reactive, complex organic molecule, which can be used in conjunction with oxygen as a combustible fuel. It is refined from {THING:ItemVolatiles}.
Due to obscure and largely forgotten {LINK:ODA;ODA} regulations, volatiles are sometimes labeled 'H2' by various items of technology. However, though they are similar to hydrogen, they're not 'actually' hydrogen. {GAS:Volatiles} will not produce {GAS:Water} when combusted, without a catalyst (see the {THING:H2Combustor}). Alone, they create {GAS:Pollutant}s and {GAS:CarbonDioxide} when burned in the following ratio:
2 {GAS:Volatiles} + 1 {GAS:Oxygen} -> 3 {GAS:Pollutant} + 6 {GAS:CarbonDioxide} + heat.

Also known as 'X', {GAS:Pollutant} is created when smelting certain metals. A concentration of 0.1 mol or greater will cause your suit to warn about poison in the atmosphere.
Pollutant has a high specific heat, making it an excellent coolant. Unfortunately it is extremely bad for organic beings, and will severely damage the lungs of most {REAGENT:Carbon} based organisms.

You can obtain water by smelting or crushing {THING:ItemIce} using a {THING:StructureFurnace} or an {THING:StructureIceCrusher}, or by combusting {GAS:Volatiles} and oxygen using the {THING:H2Combustor}.
{GAS:Water} is critical for {LINK:OrganicPage;plants} to stay alive, and grow {LINK:NutritionPage;food}. It is also an exceptional coolant with a very high specific heat capacity.
Note: {GAS:Water} was previously treated as a gas, but a new system for liquids is being developed, including separate pipes, tanks, pumps, etc for liquids. {GAS:Water} is currently the only available liquid, and does not presently change states.

Nitrous oxide is a reactive gas that will knock players out if inhaled. It acts as an oxidizer for combustion, and allows volatiles to burn significantly hotter, faster, and at a lower autoignition temperature. It can be produced in an energy intensive process inside of a {THING:StructureNitrolyzer}.
